abstract.text: Synchronously loads image data and creates a Metal texture from the named texture asset in an asset catalog.

inlineContent.text: The name of a texture in an asset catalog.
The scale factor of texture to request.
In iOS and tvOS, pass the
value of the view where you plan to display texture content.
In macOS, pass the
value of the window where you plan to display texture content.

abstract.text: The backing scale factor.
Keys to specify in a `textureOperations` dictionary.
The scale factor applied to the layer.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
Build Metal apps quicker and easier using a common set of utility classes.
An object that creates textures from existing data in common image formats.
Keys and values used to specify loading options.
A key used to specify whether the texture data is stored as sRGB image data.
A key used to specify how cube texture data is arranged in the source image.
A key used to specify whether the texture loader should generate mipmaps for the texture.
A key used to specify when to flip the pixel coordinates of the texture.
Synchronously loads image data and creates a Metal texture from the named texture asset in an asset catalog.
Asynchronously loads image data and creates a Metal texture from the named texture asset in an asset catalog.
Synchronously loads image data and creates a Metal texture from the named texture asset in an asset catalog, using a specified display gamut.
Asynchronously loads image data and creates a Metal texture from the named texture asset in an asset catalog.
Asynchronously loads image data and creates Metal textures from the specified list of named texture assets in an asset catalog.
Asynchronously loads image data and creates Metal textures from the specified list of named texture assets in an asset catalog.
A representation of the code and resources stored in a bundle directory on disk.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
A resource that holds formatted image data.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
